commitResults.messageBody:
Current default setup made

Want to create a new personality and new name

Remove Duke from Duke.java and create Lumi,
refactoring all Duke elements to Lumi

Want to make sure that there is no trace
of Duke

Currently, Lumi was at its base form.

However, it was still very dull and needed some life
and most importantly, randomness!

Enhance Lumi personality with varied intro and goodbye

To show off what I have learnt from the past week, I
wanted to create strings and use the Math library to
randomise the output for intro and goodbye.

Currently, Lumi is only able to show its
character.

However, it is not able to exchange words with
the user.

Lumi echo user, and exits on bye

This is to create a simple interface for interaction.
To make it more personalised, we asked for user's name.
More complicated features will be created in later commits.

Currently Lumi can only read the inputs and echo
back.

We need to create a list function for the user
to keep track of tasks.

Add list function and echo text back to user

Now, we add a list function so that it can confirm
the input of the user. When asked for the list,
Lumi can provide the List in point form for neatness.

commitResults.messageTitle: Mark and unmark list,check remaining tasks
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently I can only add and read from the list.

There is a need to allow the user to know what
tasks they have done and what tasks are
remaining.

Mark and unmark list, and show remaining tasks

By mark and unmarking, the user can properly keep
track of all tasks,and even has a count for remaining
tasks that are not done yet.

Currently, it was using just all just written
to the Lumi.java file which was abit messy.

In the long run, classes should be used so
that we can organise each function.

Create Task class and reorganise structure
of the file

This will ease the chatbot making process
as we create more classes and increase
the complexity of the chatbot.

Currently, the list works fine, but
it does not tell the user when the list
is empty, or when it is full.

The user will not know what is wrong with
the code as the list just does not get
updated.

Consider Edge Case for List, when List
is empty or full.

Using if statements, we will take care of
these exceptions.
